text: Ye are the light of the world. A city that is set on an hill cannot be hid.
Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.
Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
O taste and see that the LORD is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.
Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.
I have set the LORD always before me: because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.
What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.
So teach us to number our days, that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.
And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.
Trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us.
But Jesus beheld them, and said unto them, With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible.
Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.
Cast thy burden upon the LORD, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.
Wait on the LORD: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the LORD.
He that dwelleth in the secret place of the most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.
When my father and my mother forsake me, then the LORD will take me up.
And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christs sake hath forgiven you.
Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.
When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
Let every thing that hath breath praise the LORD. Praise ye the LORD.
And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.
The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.
Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.
As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!
Behold, his soul which is lifted up is not upright in him: but the just shall live by his faith.
And he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.
But thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
I press toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.
But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.
Many are the afflictions of the righteous: but the LORD delivereth him out of them all.
For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.
He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside the still waters.
He restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his names sake.
O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: because his mercy endureth for ever.
The LORD is nigh unto all them that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.
For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again: but the wicked shall fall into mischief.
Call unto me, and I will answer thee, and show thee great and mighty things, which thou knowest not.
For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.
He is not here: for he is risen, as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.
I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.
Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.
Bear ye one anothers burdens, and so fulfil the law of Christ.
For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.
And he is before all things, and by him all things consist.
In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.
Faithful is he that calleth you, who also will do it.
And the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God, and into the patient waiting for Christ.
For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succour them that are tempted.
O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.
But he knoweth the way that I take: when he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.
I waited patiently for the LORD; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.
Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.
For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.
In the multitude of my thoughts within me thy comforts delight my soul.
The entrance of thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.
The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the LORD shall be safe.
Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour.
And ye shall seek me, and find me, when ye shall search for me with all your heart.
Yet I will rejoice in the LORD, I will joy in the God of my salvation.
Not by might, nor by power, but by my spirit, saith the LORD of hosts.
For to be carnally minded is death; but to be spiritually minded is life and peace.
Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.
Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.
Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.
Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.
Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.
The righteous cry, and the LORD heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.
Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.
For thou art my hope, O Lord GOD: thou art my trust from my youth.
My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
Great peace have they which love thy law: and nothing shall offend them.
The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.
Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
And the work of righteousness shall be peace; and the effect of righteousness quietness and assurance for ever.
He giveth power to the faint; and to them that have no might he increaseth strength.
Behold, I am the LORD, the God of all flesh: is there any thing too hard for me?
But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream.
He that believeth on me, as the scripture hath said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.
That your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men, but in the power of God.
For God hath not called us unto uncleanness, but unto holiness.
To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, showing all meekness unto all men.
Because it is written, Be ye holy; for I am holy.
He that hath the Son hath life; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.
Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
Therefore with joy shall ye draw water out of the wells of salvation.
Some trust in chariots, and some in horses: but we will remember the name of the LORD our God.
Shew me thy ways, O LORD; teach me thy paths.
When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, LORD, will I seek.
Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD; and the people whom he hath chosen for his own inheritance.
The steps of a good man are ordered by the LORD: and he delighteth in his way.
God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved: God shall help her, and that right early.
For this God is our God for ever and ever: he will be our guide even unto death.
And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.
The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.
For thou hast been a shelter for me, and a strong tower from the enemy.
Because thy lovingkindness is better than life, my lips shall praise thee.
Wilt thou not revive us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?
O satisfy us early with thy mercy; that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
Light is sown for the righteous, and gladness for the upright in heart.
Serve the LORD with gladness: come before his presence with singing.
Bless the LORD, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name.
O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.
The LORD shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul.
The LORD taketh pleasure in them that fear him, in those that hope in his mercy.
Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.
I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.
The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.
Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop: but a good word maketh it glad.
A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
Mans goings are of the LORD; how can a man then understand his own way?
A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.
If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small.
He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.
Where there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.
The LORD is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.
For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.
Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself.
Watch therefore: for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come.
Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe, all things are possible to him that believeth.
And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.
Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?
Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.
If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.
Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.
Let your moderation be known unto all men. The Lord is at hand.
Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means. The Lord be with you all.
Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.
Confess your faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed.
And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever.
Behold, I come quickly: blessed is he that keepeth the sayings of the prophecy of this book.
And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.
And he said, My presence shall go with thee, and I will give thee rest.
For I am the LORD, I change not; therefore ye sons of Jacob are not consumed.
Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself: I am the LORD.
My foot hath held his steps, his way have I kept, and not declined.
The LORD is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?
I wait for the LORD, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.
He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.
Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.
LORD, thou wilt ordain peace for us: for thou also hast wrought all our works in us.
If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.
For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.
In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God.
Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.
I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love.
Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.
Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.
Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
Casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.
And now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of these is charity.
A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.
A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.
Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.
I sought the LORD, and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.
Blessed are the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.
Blessed are they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be filled.
Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee.
Blessed are the pure in heart: for they shall see God.
In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
For the LORD is good; his mercy is everlasting; and his truth endureth to all generations.
In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.
When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.
He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.
Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.
There are many devices in a man's heart; nevertheless the counsel of the LORD, that shall stand.
The eyes of the LORD are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.
Better is little with the fear of the LORD than great treasure and trouble therewith.
Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.
Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.
Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
The LORD trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.
And above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity shall cover the multitude of sins.
Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.
See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise.
Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.
With men it is impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.
For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: but the word of our God shall stand for ever.
The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it?
In God I will praise his word, in God I have put my trust.
Sing forth the honour of his name: make his praise glorious.
Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise.
Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits.
It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man.
Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed thereto according to thy word.
I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help.
My help cometh from the LORD, which made heaven and earth.
The LORD is good to all: and his tender mercies are over all his works.
To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven.
He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.
A man's pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.
It is of the LORD'S mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.
The fear of the LORD is the instruction of wisdom; and before honour is humility.
By humility and the fear of the LORD are riches, and honour, and life.
Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.
Behold, I come quickly: hold that fast which thou hast, that no man take thy crown.
Be kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another.
Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen.
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.
For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life.
For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love.
My little children, let us not love in word, neither in tongue; but in deed and in truth.
There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God.
What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who can be against us?
Every word of God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.
Delight thyself also in the LORD; and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath.
And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the LORD require of thee.
Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.
So then faith cometh by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.
This is the day which the LORD hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.
But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.
A man's heart deviseth his way: but the LORD directeth his steps.
He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.
Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another.
The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.
For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God:
Seek ye the LORD while he may be found, call ye upon him while he is near:
Blessed is the man that trusteth in the LORD, and whose hope the LORD is.
These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace.
Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:
The LORD is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble; and he knoweth them that trust in him.
The LORD make his face shine upon thee, and be gracious unto thee:
The LORD lift up his countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.
The LORD shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.
For the word of the LORD is right; and all his works are done in truth.
God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
I will say of the LORD, He is my refuge and my fortress: my God; in him will I trust.
For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,
And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men.
My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations.
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
And the light shineth in darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not.
Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; for he is faithful that promised;
The Lord liveth; and blessed be my rock; and exalted be the God of the rock of my salvation.
For I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth.
Rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing instant in prayer;
I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith:
And this is the record, that God hath given to us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.
I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, the first and the last.
He which testifieth these things saith, Surely I come quickly. Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus.
I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep.
As ye have therefore received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk ye in him:
Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
The Lord shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
Seek the Lord and his strength, seek his face continually.
Be ye strong therefore, and let not your hands be weak: for your work shall be rewarded.
My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
The Lord is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.
For I desired mercy, and not sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.
For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus' sake.
God is a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth.
I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou, Lord, only makest me dwell in safety.
But his delight is in the law of the Lord; and in his law doth he meditate day and night.
The earth is the Lord's, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.
For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.
I know that thou canst do every thing, and that no thought can be withholden from thee.
Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say, Rejoice.
